solution_line_template: Jack's mother asked him to buy {mother_multiplier} * {initial_bottles} = <<{mother_multiplier}*{initial_bottles}={bottles_mother_requested}>>{bottles_mother_requested} bottles of water.
Thus Jack bought {initial_bottles} + {bottles_mother_requested} = <<{initial_bottles}+{bottles_mother_requested}={total_bottles}>>{total_bottles} bottles of water in total.
Altogether, the bottles of water cost {total_bottles} * ${bottle_cost} = $<<{total_bottles}*{bottle_cost}={total_water_cost}>>{total_water_cost}.
So Jack spent ${total_water_cost} + ${cheese_cost} = $<<{total_water_cost}+{cheese_cost}={total_spent}>>{total_spent} on water and cheese.
Since he started with ${initial_money}, he now has ${initial_money} - ${total_spent} = $<<{initial_money}-{total_spent}={money_remaining}>>{money_remaining} left.
